title: Technical Reference Documentation for Source Interface
description: This documentation provides an overview of the Source interface, detailing its properties and intended use for representing source objects.
author: Documentation Team

blocks.content: The Source interface defines the structure for a source object, which includes the following properties.

id: string
- A unique identifier for the source.

title: string
- The title of the source.

url: string
- The URL pointing to the source.
The Source interface does not include any constants or default values as it is a simple data structure.

Since the Source interface is a simple data structure, there are no defined error scenarios. However, when implementing logic that utilizes this interface, developers should ensure that the properties are populated with valid string values.
The Source interface is compatible with any TypeScript environment.
